intro: Cryptantha holoptera, commonly known as the narrowleaf cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, mat-forming growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Cryptantha holoptera is often found in open grasslands and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
